titleStmt.title: A. Garnett et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5097

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The undersigned Citizens of Lewis County, would respectfully represent that William Fuller was fined at the last term of the Lewis Circuit Court Fifty Dollars, for injuring the property of Geo Rea. Reas property was injured in the night & his wife testified that She believed Fuller was present. She is old and feeble & was evidently mistaken in the night time as we are satisfied Fuller was not present. Parties of respectability whose evidence we believe to be true in every particular Say & say they are ready to swear that they know that Fuller was not present. We believe them and do not wish to see a man we believe to be both honest & innocent pay a fine especially as he is poor & unable to lose the mone we therefore respectfully & earnestly petition you to remit it Cabbin Creek Lewis Co Ky June 24th 1864

A. Garrett
John H. Hinnes
Jones Triezdelle
G W. Bell
N. J. Hook
H J Bell
Andrew Marie
W. H. Hendrickson
J. H. Garrett
